availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew M. Camron (Harrison County, KY, stonecutter)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, stonecutter. Pennsylvania native. Married to Ann Glasgow Camron in Nicholas County, Kentucky, on February 2, 1815. Father of Sarah Camron. Stonecutter in Harrison County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 1, p. 94A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 128A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Nicholas County Marriages, Film 000252395, p. 479.
"Andrew McCune “A. M.” Camron (1790-1873)," Find A Grave, Memorial 22158792, accessed January 28, 2024, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/22158792.
